item.title: Emma add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Emma add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies." -- Aristotle

item.title: Emma add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Emma add a quote by Elizabeth Drew
item.description: "The test of literature is, I suppose, whether we ourselves live more intensely for the reading of it." -- Elizabeth Drew

item.title: Emma add a quote by Immanuel Kant
item.description: "Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life. " -- Immanuel Kant

item.title: Emma add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Emma add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "The only escape from the miseries of life are music and cats..." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Emma add a quote by William Lyon Phelps
item.description: "This is the final test of a gentleman: His respect for those who can be of no possible service to him." -- William Lyon Phelps

item.title: Emma add a quote by PEARL S. BUCK
item.description: "The young do not know enough to be prudent, and therefore they attempt the impossible -- and achieve it, generation after generation." -- PEARL S. BUCK

item.title: Emma add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Life is short, but there is always time enough for courtesy." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Emma add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Emma add a quote by DENG MING-DAO
item.description: "Those truly linked don't need correspondence. When they meet again after many years apart, Their friendship is as true as ever." -- DENG MING-DAO

item.title: Emma add a quote by HENRY DAVID THOREAU
item.description: "When I hear music, I fear no danger. I am invulnerable. I see no foe. I am related to the earliest times, and to the latest." -- HENRY DAVID THOREAU

item.title: Emma add a quote by ANAIS NIN
item.description: "Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death." -- ANAIS NIN

item.title: Emma add a quote by MARILYN FERGUSON
item.description: "It's not so much that we're afraid of change or so in love with the old ways, but it's that place in between that we fear . . . . It's like being between trapezes. It's Linus when his blanket is in the dryer. There's nothing to hold on to." -- MARILYN FERGUSON

item.title: Emma add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Emma add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee and just as hard to sleep after." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Emma add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Emma add a quote by FRANK CRANE
item.description: "You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you don't trust enough." -- FRANK CRANE
